channel.title: [PI] Drops [PI]
channel.description:
How do you make it so an NPC drops a certant item percentage wise, example: bandos drops BCP 5% of the time he is killed?
Can we also just stop reading this, can someone just post an answer? even if it says "you can't do this" just tell me something instead of making me wait.

item.title: [PI] Drops [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“AnonymousZ, post:2, topic:406271”]Data > cfg > NPCDrops.tsm

3200:45 995:75000
1038:1 1040:1 1042:1 1044:1 1046:2 1048:1 15924:1 15935:1 15946:1 16023:1

^My drops for Chaos Elemental^

3200: 45 995:75000 < – 100% drop of 75K coins.
1038:1 <-- This is on the RARE item row, so the chances of getting it are obviously rarer.

Basically, second row is the RARE item row.

Hope this helped you understand…[/quote]
…

3200:[color=navy]45 [color=green]995:[color=orange]75000
[color=green]1038:[color=orange]1[/color][/color][/color][/color][/color]

Red = NPC ID
Navy Blue = Ratio (In the case it is 45. The code is basically saying you should receive one rare drop every 45 kills. Rare drops are located on bottom row, common on top.)
Green = Item ID
Orange = Quantity

So the originally extended code from AnonymousZ: (I extended top row)

3200:45 995:75000 4587:1
1038:1 1040:1 1042:1 1044:1 1046:2 1048:1 15924:1 15935:1 15946:1 16023:1
Basically, you have a randomized chance of either getting 75,000 coins or 1 Dragon Scimitar, or if you had that like 1/45 kill, you’d receive a random rare drop from the bottom row.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Drops [PI]
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

Data > cfg > NPCDrops.tsm

3200:45 995:75000
1038:1 1040:1 1042:1 1044:1 1046:2 1048:1 15924:1 15935:1 15946:1 16023:1

^My drops for Chaos Elemental^

3200: 45 995:75000 < – 100% drop of 75K coins.
1038:1 <-- This is on the RARE item row, so the chances of getting it are obviously rarer.

Basically, second row is the RARE item row.

Hope this helped you understand…
